posts.message:
How a scientist writing software just as part of simulations / research handles the bit of testing in software...

He sounds like he thinks his approach is far from general buzz advice. I think he is quite similar to what many would do in "real life" projects, not that it can't be improved. Have a look!

posts.description: Automated testing and research softwareThu 18 October 2012ByC. posts.message:
When I see the tour video in this product homepage, I feel that the .NET world is so fragmented. See how things like BDD-tests, feature-branches, DB-migrations, environment-configuration (dev, prod, ..), and more ... are just seemly integrated together.
It's not just a tool thing I believe, sure, the IDE makes it much easier, but the defined (obviously opinionated) process is there, and looks pretty mature. I'm officially impressed.
posts.caption: www.jetbrains.com
posts.description: The most intelligent Ruby on Rails IDE with rails code refactorings and code completion

posts.message: Any one help me understand this, Please !!!!!!!!!!!
posts.caption: blogs.msdn.com
posts.description: Recursionis beautiful andlambdasare the ultimate abstraction.  But how can they be used together?  Lambdas are anonymous functions and recursion requires names.  Let's try to define a lambda that computes the nth fibonacci number.
